item.description:
“We’re here, we’re queer, get used to it” has been for decades the stock in trade of the gay rights movement so far — but the struggle in more recent years for equal rights in love and marriage has generated a tidal wave of positive political and social change and invited a larger part of the mainstream America (and global population) to identify and empathize with those working on behalf of gay rights.

Might the secular movement experience a similar revival with increased focus on our shared values of love and compassion?

In this exclusive event, Herb Silverman, President of the Secular Coalition for America and David Niose, the President of the American Humanist Association -- two of the biggest organizations representing nonreligious Americans-- join forces to tackle this question, while each debuting their new books exploring secularism and US politics.

This event is presented as part of the ongoing 2012-2013 distinguished speaker series "An Ethic of Love", sponsored by the Humanist Community at Harvard.

Sunday, October 14, 1:30pm at the Harvard Science Center (One Oxford Street) Hall E. The Humanist Mindfulness Group will host meditation at 12 Eliot Street at 3:00pm. FREE BRUNCH at 12:30pm before the event.

As part of the Fall 2012 Humanist Learning Lab pilot, free childcare will be offered at all "An Ethic of Love" events. The HCH has reserved a limited number of free parking spots in the Littauer Lot -- first come, first served.
item.name: The Politics of Love: Dave Niose and Herb Silverman
